data.company_description:
Entrio is a trade journaling and review platform for traders who want to improve their decision making without the friction of manual logging.

Instead of typing trades into spreadsheets or complex journals, traders capture their setups using screenshots. Entrio analyzes these images and automatically extracts relevant trade details such as symbol, direction, entry, and exit where possible. Combined with short personal notes, a structured trade entry can be created in seconds not minutes.

Entrio is built for post trade reflection, helping traders review what they saw, what they decided, and why not just the outcome.

Integrate Entrio with your existing tools to streamline your trading workflow and turn screenshots and notes into consistent learning.

data.company_description:
ETH Zurich – Where the future begins

Freedom and individual responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit and open-mindedness: ETH Zurich stands on a bedrock of true Swiss values. Our university for science and technology dates back to the year 1855, when the founders of modern-day Switzerland created it as a centre of innovation and knowledge. At ETH Zurich, students discover an ideal environment for independent thinking, researchers a climate which in-spires top performance. Situated in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, ETH Zurich is pioneering effective solutions to the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

Some 530 professors teach around 20,500 students – including 4,100 doctoral students – from over 120 countries. Their collective research embraces many disciplines: natural sciences and engineering scienc-es, architecture, mathematics, system-oriented natural sciences, as well as management and social sci-ences. The results and innovations produced by ETH researchers are channelled into some of Switzer-land’s most high-tech sectors: from computer science through to micro- and nanotechnology and cutting-edge medicine. Every year ETH registers around 90 patents and 200 inventions on average. Since 1996, the university has produced a total of 380 commercial spin-offs. ETH also has an excellent reputation in scientific circles: 21 Nobel laureates have studied, taught or researched here, and in international league tables ETH Zurich regularly ranks as one of the world’s top universities.

data.about:
I am a Product-minded Tech Lead and Founding Engineer who combines the agility of a startup founder with the rigor of a systems architect.

My journey began with the challenge of building an e-commerce ecosystem from the very first line of code. I scaled the platform from 0 to 1, engineering an architecture capable of handling high-throughput traffic and enabling massive year-over-year growth. That track record of turning code into business value earned me a seat on the company's Board of Directors, where I continue to advise on technical strategy today.

Currently, I bring that same "owner’s mindset" to my role as a Tech Lead for a well-established Swiss marketplace platform. My work focuses on bridging the gap between legacy infrastructure and modern performance—whether that means rearchitecting search systems to reduce latency by 20x , or integrating production-ready GenAI features that solve real user problems without breaking infrastructure constraints.

Driven by a belief in continuous learning, I am concurrently pursuing a DAS in Data Science at ETH Zürich to keep pushing the boundaries of my technical expertise.

I don't just (vibe) code; I build resilient, cost-optimized systems that are designed to scale.
data.company_description:
Willkommen bei der Renuo AG – Softwareentwicklung

Wir sind Ihr Partner für Webentwicklung, Prototyping und Künstliche Intelligenz.

Wir entwickeln webbasierte Software in der Schweiz für nationale und internationale Kundschaft. Spezialisiert sind wir auf umfassende Portale und komplexe Plattformen, die schnell bedient werden und auf jedem Gerät einwandfrei funktionieren müssen. Stets in unserem Fokus liegt die Qualität und Sicherheit. Dank unserem Standort in Wallisellen bei Zürich pflegen wir kurze Kommunikationswege zu unserer Kundschaft. Dies ist für uns besonders wichtig, da wir mit agilen Projektmanagement-Methoden wie Scrum arbeiten. Dies und die enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren geschäftlichen Kontakten ist Teil unseres Erfolgskonzepts.

Als junges und top ausgebildetes Team deckt unser Know-How die neusten Technologien und Systeme ab. In der schnelllebigen, digitalen Welt ist es unser Auftrag, immer auf dem neusten Stand zu bleiben und uns kontinuierlich weiterzubilden. Wir entwickeln keine Standard-Lösungen, sondern gehen auf jeden Auftrag individuell ein. Deshalb sind unsere Projekte auch so individuell wie unsere Kundschaft. Technologien, welche wir häufig verwenden, sind Ruby on Rails und React.

experiences.description:
Here, at EPFL iGEM 2018, we are working on developing new kits to make cancer treatment and monitoring more accessible, reliable and cheaper using synthetic biology tools. 

The iGEM competition is an annual competition, which is held at MIT University. In this competition, each year more than 300 student teams from all over the world participate to present their projects in the synthetic biology field. 

As the president of EPFL iGEM team, I am responsible for planning the project, defining and assigning different roles, completing the financing of the project, managing day-to-day activities, formulating the strategy for reaching our goals, and leading the team. 

Along with my managerial role, I was also a leading technical member in designing and experimenting our detection kit, in which we used Cas12a system coupled to an isothermal amplification to detect ctDNA and miRNA as possible biomarkers for monitoring the vaccine efficiency and also detecting relapse.
experiences.title: President of EPFL iGEM 2018

experiences.description:
Nomoko is a Swiss startup with a vision to make the physical world machine-readable. 

We’re on a mission to create a complete Digital Twin ecosystem that will transform industry – and we’re starting with the world’s biggest financial asset class. Nomoko is turning the inaccessible physical assets of real estate into data-rich machine-readable Digital Twins.

Our Digital Twin Platform, Praedia, takes the siloed tools, fractured processes and unusable data of real estate and turns them into a unified, contextualized digital whole. A place where everyone involved at any stage of a building’s life can access and understand it digitally without the need to interact with it physically.

In Praedia Store we’ve built an ecosystem for real estate apps and services that digitizes every aspect of real estate from the ground up. With it we're starting an era of companies that do real estate digitally by design and giving them the platform to succeed from.

Nomoko was funded by the EU's Horizon 2020 research and innovation program and has been listed in the top 100 Swiss startups for four years in a row. It won the 26th Prix Strategis Best Swiss Startup 2019, the 22nd IMD Startup Competition 2019/20 and is the winner of the Swiss Prime Site Startup Accelerator as ‘Innovator in Smart Cities, Smart Buildings & Mobility'.  

To find out how Nomoko is using Digital Twins to transform industry and give businesses a competitive edge, visit nomoko.world

That experience taught me how to:

# What I do

At Boltshauser Solutions, I build web apps that:

From MVPs to internal tools — I turn ideas into software that matters.

# How I work

Building great software is an art.

It’s not just code — it’s understanding.

My process is:

data.about:
I am currently working as a CV/ML research scientist at the Microsoft Spatial AI team in Zurich.

Previously, as a ML Researcher at CERN, I was exploring the potential of Graph Neural Networks to enhance particle reconstructions at the CMS Experiment. I developed a novel 3D energy deposit linking algorithm based on graph neural networks, which can handle the increased data complexity from the upcoming High-Luminosity Large Hadron Collider upgrade. This algorithm is expected to improve the accuracy and efficiency of the particle identification and measurement process, and contribute to the advancement of high-energy physics research.

I graduated with a MSc in Cybernetics and Robotics from the Czech Technical University in Prague, where I also completed a prg.ai Minor in Artificial Intelligence. During my studies, I worked as a Computer Vision Researcher at the Center for Machine Perception, and collaborated with the Google Research team on an open-source project. I created and optimized a state-of-the-art CNN-based image retrieval algorithm, which is now part of the TensorFlow Python repository. I also interned at Microsoft, where I researched and implemented a solution for noise suppression in robot speech recognition using digital signal processing and neural network techniques. I published a paper on this topic, as well as another paper on using Labanotation to represent robot motions and collect noise templates.

I am passionate about Machine Learning, particularly Computer Vision, Data Analysis, and R&D. I have experience with AI, creating applications for visual retrieval and robotic perception. I possess proficiency in Python and popular machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow. Additionally, I am skilled in C/C++ and have extensive experience working with the robot operating system ROS2. I enjoy undertaking captivating projects in my free time, such as creating sign language translating gloves and an augmented reality blockchain-based game, which won me awards at hackathons. I am motivated by learning new technologies, solving challenging problems, and collaborating with diverse and talented teams.

experiences.description:
• I developed a novel 3D energy deposit linking algorithm based on graph neural networks for the CMS Experiment at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN. 

Description:
The upcoming High-Luminosity Large Hadron Collider (HL-LHC) upgrade is set to increase the number of particle collisions, presenting a significant challenge to existing reconstruction algorithms. To address the associated rise in data complexity, the Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) at LHC is developing a new endcap High-Granularity Calorimeter (HGCAL) that can withstand the HL-LHC's harsher conditions and investigate high-energy collisions. During the particle shower reconstruction phase in HGCAL, 3D graph structures called tracksters are produced, believed to originate from the same physics object. However, due to the detector's irregular geometry, physics processes, and particle overlaps (pile-up), tracksters are often fragmented, degrading the reconstruction quality. In my work, I investigated machine learning approaches with a particular emphasis on Graph Neural Network (GNN) models to enhance event reconstruction through improved calorimetric clustering. 

Outcomes:
• An end-to-end trainable GNN-based algorithm for accumulating incomplete energy fragments into well-formed tracksters was proposed by me with the goal of re-connecting trackster fragments. 
• The algorithm is integrated into the CMS Software package as a linking plug-in, and its clustering and physics reconstruction performance is evaluated on simulation data. 
• The model outperforms the currently used rule-based state-of-the-art benchmark in all metrics and improves ParticleFlow reconstruction even in the challenging environment of HL-LHC.

data.company_description:
ETH Zurich – Where the future begins

Freedom and individual responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit and open-mindedness: ETH Zurich stands on a bedrock of true Swiss values. Our university for science and technology dates back to the year 1855, when the founders of modern-day Switzerland created it as a centre of innovation and knowledge. At ETH Zurich, students discover an ideal environment for independent thinking, researchers a climate which in-spires top performance. Situated in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, ETH Zurich is pioneering effective solutions to the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

Some 530 professors teach around 20,500 students – including 4,100 doctoral students – from over 120 countries. Their collective research embraces many disciplines: natural sciences and engineering scienc-es, architecture, mathematics, system-oriented natural sciences, as well as management and social sci-ences. The results and innovations produced by ETH researchers are channelled into some of Switzer-land’s most high-tech sectors: from computer science through to micro- and nanotechnology and cutting-edge medicine. Every year ETH registers around 90 patents and 200 inventions on average. Since 1996, the university has produced a total of 380 commercial spin-offs. ETH also has an excellent reputation in scientific circles: 21 Nobel laureates have studied, taught or researched here, and in international league tables ETH Zurich regularly ranks as one of the world’s top universities.

experiences.description:
Antibody language models are protein language models trained specifically to model antibodies, which are highly diverse proteins that play an important role in the immune system. For my thesis I:
- Set up a training and testing pipeline for protein language models

data.company_description:
EPFL (Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne) is one of two Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology.

Its location on the shores of Lake Geneva, EPFL brings together a campus of more than 10,000 people. By its novel structure, the school stimulates collaboration between students, professors, researchers and entrepreneurs. These daily interactions give rise to new and groundbreaking work in science, technology and architecture.
